definition: tabernacle (biblical word for a meeting hall or tent)
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
curtain or screen/canopy or tent/headquarters of a general/act (of a play)

sentences.english: Zechariah son of Meshelemiah was the gatekeeper at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
sentences.chinese: 米施利米雅的兒子撒迦利雅是看守會幕之門的。

sentences.english: So all the work on the tabernacle, the Tent of Meeting, was completed.
sentences.chinese: 帳幕，就是會幕，一切的工就這樣做完了。

sentences.english: He is to lay his hand on the head of his offering and slaughter it at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
sentences.chinese: 他要按手在供物的頭上，宰於會幕門口。

definition: Abraham (name)/Abraham, father of Judaism and Islam in the Bible and Quran/same as Ibrahim 易卜拉辛
Jehovah (biblical name for God, Hebrew: YHWH)/compare Yahweh 雅威[Ya3 wei1] and God 上帝[Shang4 di4]
Holy Father/God the Father (in the Christian Trinity)
Book of Genesis/First Book of Moses
